Mesna afera: slovenski trg je zbirališče slabe hrane, vprašljive kakovosti?
Očitno je v Sloveniji še vedno najpomembnejša nizka cena, ne pa kakovost, ugibajo v Sindikatu kmetov Slovenije.
02 Nov 2019, 08:46 by A. L.
LJUBLJANA – Po avstrijski aferi (do zdaj je Avstrija v urejenosti trga s kmetijskimi pridelki in mesom za slovenske kmete in uradnike veljala kot vzoren primer urejenega, varnega ter transparentnega trga), ko so številni trgovci umikali od tam uvoženo meso iz polic trgovin v Sloveniji, se je oglasil zaskrbljeni Sindikat kmetov Slovenije. »Meso v Avstriji je dražje kot v Sloveniji, zato se lahko le vprašamo, kakšen je povod za nakup mnogih slovenskih podjetji, ki so meso kupovale v Avstriji, meso pa namenili izključno za predelavo. Očitno je v Sloveniji še vedno najpomembnejša nizka cena, ne pa kakovost. Dokler bo tako, bo slovensko tržišče, zbirališče slabe hrane, vprašljive kakovosti,« izpostavljajo. Potrošnike pozivajo, da se obrnejo raje na okoliške kmete in naj kupujejo meso slovenskega izvora.​
​Slovenija je samooskrbna z govejim mesom, veliko svinjskega mesa pa uvozimo.

Meat Affair: Slovenian market is a gathering place for bad food of questionable quality?
Obviously, low price, not quality, is still the most important in Slovenia, according to the Union of Farmers of Slovenia.
02 Nov 2019, 08:46 by A.L.
LJUBLJANA - Following the Austrian affair (until now Austria was considered a good example of a regulated, safe and transparent market in the regulation of the market for agricultural produce and meat), when many traders were withdrawing imported meat from shelves in Slovenia, a worried Union of Farmers of Slovenia came forward. “Meat is more expensive in Austria than it is in Slovenia, so we can only wonder what the reason for the purchase of many Slovenian companies that bought meat in Austria, and intended the meat exclusively for processing. Obviously, low price, not quality, is still the most important in Slovenia. As long as this is the case, the Slovenian market, a gathering place for bad food, will be of questionable quality, "they point out. Consumers are urged to turn to the surrounding farmers and buy meat of Slovenian origin.
Slovenia is self-sufficient with beef, and a lot of pork is imported.
